instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3481: What is 820-3481? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.820-3299: What is 820-3299? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
device is working good but no external display possible, both ports I can connect the cable but monitor has "no signal"

dont found schematic and boardview but i took the <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3299</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> seems to be similar.

L9400 and L9600 both sides have 3.3V

<CHIP>U9610</CHIP> pin 19/20   3.3V

TBTA/<SIGNAL>BPWRSW_EN</SIGNAL> is 3.3V
<SIGNAL>TBT_S0_EN</SIGNAL> = 3.3V

<SIGNAL>TBT_A</SIGNAL>/B _HV_EN is 0V
<RESISTOR>R3688</RESISTOR>/87 is 10K

perhaps I have a problem with <CHIP>U3600</CHIP>? 

<RESISTOR>R3695</RESISTOR> has 806 ohm, on Pin 2 ans 1 is a nice clock with 25MHz


I am stucked now with this problem and would be glas about some help

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
Did you try another thunderbolt adapter?
Confirm is good testing it on other machine.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
yes, with an MBP 2011 15" working good

and the client told me the problem as well. he notified the problem when he wanted to connect another display in home office.
the machine came in to replace drive and check the connector problem

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
So the client complains that external video was good before replacing HDD?
Then check for knocked off components, or broken traces.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
ok I will check that.
But the client did nothing. He only want to connect an external display and notified that it is not possible.
then he used the imac normaly until he decided to have a bigger drive. he bring the device to me for replacing and pleased me to have a look during replacing for the problem with the thunderbolt

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
So thunderbolt issue is older.
First, clean thunderbolt pins and corresponding area in the MLB.

Check <SIGNAL>TBT_A</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_HPD</SIGNAL> on the port where you connect the device.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
I cleaned the thunderbolt pins and the corresponding area on both sides from the MLB

<SIGNAL>TBT_A</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_HPD</SIGNAL> when disconnected is 0V, if connceted is 3.24V but no display to see

I check only the mainboard with RAM and extern SSD and connected extern Display, nothing more connected

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message: I found another, a real <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3299</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>. plugged in only with power and extern display cable I get a picture

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message: Check if <SIGNAL>DP_TBTPA</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_HPD</SIGNAL> goes high at same time with <SIGNAL>TBT_A</SIGNAL>/<SIGNAL>B_HPD</SIGNAL>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> iMac 2013 27" no external Display
threads.message:
Problem ist solved! thanks to [USER=2552]@EsteTron[/USER], I found the same problem
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/imac-27-late-2013-<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3481</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>.59938/[/URL]
after replacing the burned Thunderbolt Host working great again, thanks all for help
